intro: Celsia cretica, commonly known as the Cretan celsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its attractive blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Celsia cretica is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
